topics.title: Site too large error
topics.body:
If I create a new clone of the ZeroNet github repository, and start zeronet, then visit a largish site, the site does not load and I do not get a prompt asking for a size increase. As a test I used [bluishcoder blog](/1BLuish1ZbwVfPaCSDVQkg5WW58hqEoYQw). The logs for zeronet show:


    Site:1BLuis..oYQw content.json: Site too large 101655706 > 10485760, aborting task...

But no JS prompt appeared to ask me to increase site size. I see to recall it used to do this. Has something changed?

2@2.body:
* [8080 game emulator in JavaScript](/1GamESVFyJfkmbxtcrLR2VX4m4VFmwyeRY)
* [Bluishcoder blog](/13TSUryi4GhHVQYKoRvRNgok9q8KsMLncq)
* [Pitcairn Island photos](/1Jr5bnqSnnp94CfC7xrqPh4yYYDRkpzozD)
* [Mozilla Developer Network Mirror](/1MoZDevNsM5NAitt2y17jCvPWRazbjYqLe). Note that this is very large, about 3GB with 100,000+ files, and is a test of large sites.

3@2.body:
An option on ZeroHello to sort by last update time would be nice. At the moment I have to scan all the dates and try and work out which ones I haven't seen the updates for.

With regards to namecoin, you could provide an option to link to a local namecoind to do lookups like bitmessage does. Another option is to have a site that has a json file containing a dump of all valid zeronet namecoin names pulled regularly from the namecoin client. All users that have this site retrieved can then use that json for lookup.

1@16.body: Thanks for the fix! I've also updated the content.json to include the domain now.

2@62.body: I'm unable to see this. It tells me content.json could not be found. Is your node still up?
